comment: You can still taste the corpses burried on the hillside cemetary next to the watermill. Love it
Nose: oak, vanilla. Flavor: woody, toasted barley, smoky but not peaty, young/spicy, mild vanilla and citrus. Splash of water kills vanilla and citrus, leaving only wood smoke - better without.
Notes of honey on the nose; spicy on the tongue, not peaty, nice body
Very nice entry level scotch. Light sweet floral notes.
Delicious, could be smoother. Smells of fruit and spice
Huge hit at Lance's wedding. Smooth. Not like other Speyaides according to Morgan.
Robur Reserve - so vanilla-y. Sweet smooth
Light and tasting a bit like tequila
Big fan. Not presumptuous. Easy to sip. Great flavor
Nice light and smooth, with distinct nite of vanilla and fruit.

68.  A bit harsh and spicy. Had what I thought was this at Ami and Nancy's but this doesn't taste like what I remember.  What they had was much smoother and sweeter. I wouldn't buy this for my cabinet (at least the Select Reserve).
Pale gold color. Light. Reminded me of straw
Big spice and fruit notes on the nose and taste. Nice in mouth feel and finish. Open up with a bit of water, and the sweet and floral notes pickup. Overall, very pleasant light scotch.
Tasty hints of vanilla and pepper. Not a complex scotch and slightly bland for my taste. Definitely a melo time scotch.
Very light scotch with sweet notes. Too plain with not enough complexity. Definitely not the best Glenrothes bottle.
A smooth and fresh malt with a pronounced note of several sweet fruites. Easy to enjoy.
Slight spice notes, started off smooth, but got a little harsh. 7.5/10

Nothing extraordinary about the nose. Nice and easy, sweet and fresh-fruity introduction to the pallet.  Pepper and baking spice starts to become more apparent and like a gentle and mild hit of Wasabi before easing out politely. A nice all round easy fellow to befriend.

Based on tasting notes.
Smooth
No ice needed
This does just taste like a stronger version of Grouse, highly un recommended. For the money you could get 2 bottles of Ballentines which has far more to offer for the money.
Not much to it.  Kind of bland with some nice spice on the finish.
Toasted malt, vanilla, and spice dominate the nose. A soft taste mostly mellows the aroma. An nice easy drinking whisky.
Like the nose and the finish.

Lighter fare for scotch whisky but still very enjoyable. Clean finish, just a hint of peat and smoke. Slightly sweeter, almost of apple and malt with a buttery finish. There are probably better choices for the money but it's a safe choice for guests.
Cool character here. Finishes with absolutely no burn.

J'aime bien.
Pas très long en bouche cependant.
Very distinct almost tequila note. But does not taste anything like it smells. Relatively smooth. A little acidic and sharp compared to other great buys at the same price.
Simple light vanilla with touches of honey.  The bartender was using it for a rather interesting looking cocktail.  Next time, I'll try it that way!
Rond mais relevé et boisé au final
Personally,  I find it a little on the harsh side for my taste buds. A sprinkle of water calms it down a bit. Lots of flavour though.
Sweet aroma and taste. One of my newest favourites.
Too thin, not much doing here.
Good to get smashed. No burn.

Cheerful nose that's intensely sweet and aromatic, apple-blossom, sugared cereal, wildflower honey, all atop a wonderful layer of fairly pronounced petrichor... One of my favorite notes! Satisfying palate of sweet spiced apple-butter and malt, followed by a short-but-sweet, complimenting finish. For this gentle, simple style, I'm impressed. Despite being NAS, it has no obvious flaws (i.e. overly hot or disparate flavors) and it's quality and character redeem itself. Fairly priced (for now), this would be perfect for new single malt whisky drinkers, even if hardened old Islay fans turn their nose up at it...
A NAS with character. Bold fruity flavors with a touch of spice!
Lots and lots of heather and honey on the nose.  Some of the same on the palate but not as much as expected.  Spicy sweetness and a crisp finish.
Smooth all the way through. Clean with a somewhat fruity scent almost like mulled wine. Spicy finish with very little alcohol burn. One of my favorites.

While not as flashy, complex, or well-integrated as some of the age statement selections from Glenrothes, this is still a perfectly fine dram. Dried fruit, caramel, vanilla, spice, and coconut. Fairly short finish. I'd give this a 3.5 if, ya know, half-stars were a thing here (c'mon, Distiller!).
One of the most balanced drams, well, to my taste anyway.... And affordable!
Not going to try it again. Light and mellow, almost like a real scotch with too much water on it, diluted. Not recommended
Ελαφρύ, χωρίς νότες καπνίσματος αλλά με γεμάτη και ωραία γεύση

This Single Malt from the heart of Speyside is easily accessible, not very complex and comes without an age statement. The nose is characterized by toffee/caramel notes, citrus fruits and engaging hints of baked plums. However, the occasional spiritiness and rather intense brown sugar sweetness might be off-putting to some. On the palate, Glenrothes Select Reserve is mildly spicy and sweet with honey, vanilla cream and ripe fruits. The finish is short, clean and slightly dry. An average everyday dram which is comparable to a better Blended Scotch.

RATING: 3.0/5.0 stars ≙ 80 pts → AVERAGE
January 2017 at Groppis with Cory eating lunch. Nice, light scotch.
Sweet on the nose and palate. Honey, vanilla, salted caramel, hint of chocolate.

Nose: Citrus zest, with a creamy vanilla tagging along, a bit of oak with cinnamon and herbal spices. I think I am getting some floral notes at the end with fresh apples.
    
    Pallet: Watery mouth feel, honey, vanilla give way to peppery spice and oak.
    
    Finish: Charred oak, a bit a grassy note like hay. Spice lingers on the cheeks but not on the tongue. Short/Medium length.
    
    I find this to be very middle of the road. The nose is pleasing and not aggressive, but the pallet and finish does not have a lot going on. This is an every day sipper.
goldene Farbe. leicht fruchtig (citrus) und Vanille im Geruch. samtig und dickflüssig auf der Zunge. leicht fruchtig, aber mehr Vanille und marmeladig. Honig und säuerlich im Abgang

Sweet and full of flavor. The caramel and vanilla come out in the nose and flavor and the finish is simple and clean. I picked this bottle up 5 or 6 times and then put it back, kind of upset because I could have been enjoying this earlier!
As described in Distiller review, fruity with a distinguished vanilla nose and taste. Finish is sharp. Personally would not buy.
pretty easy going. zesty and spicy.
Creamy and rich with soft stewed fruit/sherry and rich honey sweetness, gentle heather spice and oak. Lighter profile but interesting, and well priced. $60 in Ontario.
Very fruity and sweet. Lots of vanilla. Brings to mind an apple pie filling. Not always in the best way but still very drinkable. No detectable smoke or peat to speak of.

Un goût franc. Pas vilain pour le prix.
Essayé chez Roch L. 2018-03.

Nose: Apple and cinnamon. Slight oak note and distant astringency. 

Pallet: Apple cider, caramel, oily mouth feel.

Finish: Oak, cinnamon, and a slight astringency.

Thoughts: This is not a complex dram, but it not bad. This is an easy sipper.
Pleasant and light. Notes of spice, fruit , and vanilla. Very easy to drink.
Soft flavor with a bit of spicy after taste.  A nice summer whisky

Very orange peely with a vanilla finish. 
Pretty decent dram.
Sweet, saccharine, boozy caramel. A lot going on, but not a perfect marriage by any means. Needs more aging. 40% ABV, not 43%.
Eh. It was pretty flat overall. Raisin on the nose. Generic sweetness on the palate. Like zero finish
Very floral and bad tasting. Maybe had a bad batch but one of the worst i’ve tasted on approx 200 whiskies
The sweet spoils of our agricultural civilization. Although a tad leathery, the bottle was emptied surprisingly fast.
Still has the classic Glenrothes honey flavor, but slightly less refined. A bit earthier.
light & caramelly, light chocolate, yum but not super deep

color: amber grain
taste: speyside soft with sweet oakiness, malt, and orange zest
aroma: open honey and vanilla
finish: dry and clean, with a bit of spice and citrus

Soapy and malty on the nose. Meh. But tastes much better than it smells. Sweet, no bite. Honey on the finish. 

Whisky tasting
Pretty one dimensional. Okay with water. Wouldn’t get again

Very vanilla caramel.

It's an OK one to enjoy at the Pleujouse Castel waiting for my plates !

My second Glenrothes, i also liked it and i am starting to build a good impression over this distillery.

Bottled at 40%abv, with a deep copper color.

On the nose very sweet, and appealing, maybe soft. Almonds, caramel, dry chocolate cake, sherry, grape juice, those sweets from formal parties, dry brown grasses and custard cream notes. Really nice.

On the palate, starts with cough syrup, the some pepper and ginger, with a mild citrus or prune note, and the taste of the finish is lovely with cremé brulee, almonds and little tobacco, medium long.

Overall i give this fellow a 91 over a 100. Actually pretty good.
Flowers and vanilla on the nose. The taste is soft and round, generally bready with some heather. The finish is gentle, and doesn't linger, but has a touch of barrel spice at the very end.
